div.l: As he were on the quak or on the pose
To bedde he goith and with hym goith his wyfe
As ony Iay so light was and Iolyfe
So was her Ioly whistil wel I wet
The Cradil at her beddis fete is set
To Rokyn̄ and to ȝevyn̄ þe Child sowke
And when̄ drowkyn̄ were al in þe Crowke
To bed went the doghter right anon̄
To bed went Aleyn̄ and also Iohn
There nas no more hem nedith no dwale
This Miller hath so wissily bibbit Ale
That as an hors he fnortith in his slepe
Ne of his taile be hynde he toke no kepe
His wyfe bare hym a burdon̄ ⁊and þat ful strong
Men̄ myght her͗e rowting here to furlong
The wench rowtith eke per company
Aleyn̄ the Clerk that herd þis melody
He pokid Iohn and seid slepist thowe
Herdist thowe evir͗e slike a song or nowe
Lo slike a complyn̄ is her͗e a mong hem al
A wild fier͗e oppon̄ her body fal
Who herd evir slike a ferly thing
They wol have the flour͗e of evil ending
This long nyght ther͗e tidis me no rest
But ȝit no fors al shal be for the best
For Iohn he seid al so mot I thryve
Yf that I may the wench wol I swyve
Som̄ ese hath lawe shapyn̄ vs
For Iohn there is a lawe þat seith thus
That yf a man̄ in o poynt be grevid
That in anothir͗e he shal be relevid
Our͗e corn̄ is stoln̄ shortly it is no nay
And wee have had an il fit al þis day
And syn̄ I sal have non̄ Amendemt
Ageyn my los I wol have som̄ esement
